title: SEE 2081 English Practice Test 3
subject: english
instructionsEnglish: Candidates are required to answer the questions in their own words as far as practicable. Figures in the margin indicate the full marks. Attempt all the questions.

questions.title: Read the poem and do the tasks.

passage.title: The Country Mouse and the City Mouse
passage.author: Richard Scrafton Sharpe
passage.content:
In a snug little cot lived a fat little mouse,
Who enjoyed, unmolested, the range of the house;
With plain food content, she would breakfast on cheese,
She dined upon bacon, and supped on grey peas.

A friend from the town to the cottage did stray,
And he said he was come a short visit to pay;
So the mouse spread her table as gay as you please,
And brought the nice bacon and charming grey peas.

The visitor frowned, and he thought to be witty:
Cried he, “You must know, I come from the city,
Where we all should be shocked at provisions like these,
For we never eat bacon and horrid grey peas.”

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Where did the country mouse live?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: The country mouse lived in a snug little cot (cottage).
subQuestions.explanationNepali: कविताको पहिलो पङ्क्तिमा भनिएको छ, "In a snug little cot lived a fat little mouse," जसको अर्थ हो कि ग्रामीण मुसा एउटा सानो, आरामदायी कुटीमा बस्थ्यो।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The first line of the poem states, "In a snug little cot lived a fat little mouse," which means the country mouse lived in a small, comfortable cottage. Citations: chapter 17, page 283.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What did the country mouse eat for her meals?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: She ate cheese for breakfast, bacon for dinner, and grey peas for supper.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: कविताले उल्लेख गर्छ, "she would breakfast on cheese, / She dined upon bacon, and supped on grey peas."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The poem mentions, "she would breakfast on cheese, / She dined upon bacon, and supped on grey peas." Citations: chapter 17, page 283.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Why did the city mouse visit the country mouse?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: He came to pay a short visit.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: कवितामा शहरी मुसाले भन्छ, "he was come a short visit to pay," जसको अर्थ हो कि ऊ छोटो भेटघाटको लागि आएको थियो।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The city mouse says in the poem that "he was come a short visit to pay," meaning he came for a brief visit. Citations: chapter 17, page 284.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: How did the city mouse react to the food he was offered?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: He frowned and said that the food was shocking and horrid.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: कविताले भन्छ, "The visitor frowned... Cried he... 'we all should be shocked at provisions like these, / For we never eat bacon and horrid grey peas.'"
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The poem states, "The visitor frowned... Cried he... 'we all should be shocked at provisions like these, / For we never eat bacon and horrid grey peas.'" Citations: chapter 17, page 284.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What does the word 'unmolested' mean in the second line?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: It means she was not disturbed or attacked.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: कविताको दोस्रो पङ्क्ति, "Who enjoyed, unmolested, the range of the house," ले देखाउँछ कि मुसालाई कसैले बाधा नपुऱ्याई घरमा रमाइलो गर्थ्यो।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The second line of the poem, "Who enjoyed, unmolested, the range of the house," indicates that the mouse enjoyed the house without being disturbed by anyone. Citations: chapter 17, page 291.

questions.title: Read the text and do the tasks.

passage.title: Pratap Malla
passage.content:
Pratap Malla was one of the most famous kings of the Malla Dynasty. He constructed some magnificent and beautiful architectural structures around Kathmandu. The way he came to the throne is very interesting and controversial. When his father Laxmi Nara Singh's madness grew worse, he imprisoned his father and ruled as a regent in Kantipur.

He was an able administrator. Kantipur was highly developed during his reign. By his tact, he was making the kings of Lalitpur and Bhaktapur play against each other. Sometimes he sided with Bhaktapur and posed a threat to Lalitpur. On other occasions, he aligned with Lalitpur and fell upon Bhaktapur.

Pratap Malla was a religious-minded person. He built a beautiful temple at Guhyeshwari and renovated the temple of Pashupatinath, raising a pinnacle over it. At Swayambhu he built Pratappur and Kabeendrapur. With a view to warding off evils, he erected an image of Hanuman by the side of his palace gate and called the palace Hanumandhoka. He also set up Sundari Chowk and Mohan Chowk inside the palace. A pond was dug at Bhandarkhal and filled with water brought from Budhanilakantha. He installed an image of Narayan lying in the pond, an exact replica from Budhanilakantha Temple.

Pratap Malla was also a vastly-learned king and a poet. He could compose poems in many languages and conferred on himself the title of 'Kabeendra', a king of poets.

subSections.title: Fill in the blanks with the correct information from the text.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Pratap Malla imprisoned his father, Laxmi Nara Singh, because of his father's __________.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: madness
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले बताउँछ, "When his father Laxmi Nara Singh's madness grew worse, he imprisoned his father..."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text states, "When his father Laxmi Nara Singh's madness grew worse, he imprisoned his father..." Citations: chapter 9, page 137.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: He used his __________ to make the kings of Lalitpur and Bhaktapur fight each other.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: tact
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठमा उल्लेख छ, "By his tact he was making the kings of Lalitpur and Bhaktapur play against each other."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text mentions, "By his tact he was making the kings of Lalitpur and Bhaktapur play against each other." Citations: chapter 9, page 137.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The palace was named Hanumandhoka after he erected an image of __________ at the gate.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: Hanuman
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले बताउँछ कि उनले "erected an image of Hanuman... by the side of his palace gate and called the palace Hanumandhoka."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text states he "erected an image of Hanuman... by the side of his palace gate and called the palace Hanumandhoka." Citations: chapter 9, page 137.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The image of Narayan at Bhandarkhal was an exact __________ of the one at Budhanilakantha.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: replica
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठमा भनिएको छ, "He installed an image of Narayan lying in the pond, an exact replica from Budhanilakantha Temple."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text says, "He installed an image of Narayan lying in the pond, an exact replica from Budhanilakantha Temple." Citations: chapter 9, page 137.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Pratap Malla gave himself the title 'Kabeendra' because he was a king of __________.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: poets
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले बताउँछ कि उनले आफूलाई 'Kabeendra', a king of poets' उपाधि दिए।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text states that he conferred on himself the title of 'Kabeendra', a king of poets. Citations: chapter 9, page 137.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What was controversial about Pratap Malla's rise to the throne?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: It was controversial because he imprisoned his own father to become the ruler.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले बताउँछ कि उनको सिंहासनमा आउने तरिका "very interesting and controversial at the same time" थियो किनभने उनले आफ्नो बुबालाई कैद गरेका थिए।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text states the way he came to the throne was "very interesting and controversial at the same time" because he imprisoned his father. Citations: chapter 9, page 137.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: How did Pratap Malla maintain control over the neighbouring kingdoms of Lalitpur and Bhaktapur?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: He made them play against each other by sometimes siding with one and sometimes with the other.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: उनले ललितपुर र भक्तपुरका राजाहरूलाई एकअर्काको विरुद्धमा खेलाएर नियन्त्रणमा राखेका थिए, कहिले एकातिर त कहिले अर्कोतिर लागेर।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: He kept the kings of Lalitpur and Bhaktapur under control by making them play against each other, siding with one and then the other. Citations: chapter 9, page 137.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Name two structures Pratap Malla built at Swayambhu.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: He built Pratappur and Kabeendrapur at Swayambhu.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठमा उल्लेख छ, "At Swayambhu he built Pratappur, Kabeendrapur..."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text mentions, "At Swayambhu he built Pratappur, Kabeendrapur..." Citations: chapter 9, page 137.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Why did he place an image of Hanuman at his palace gate?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: He placed it there to ward off evils.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठमा भनिएको छ, "With a view to warding off evils, he erected an image of Hanuman..."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text states, "With a view to warding off evils, he erected an image of Hanuman..." Citations: chapter 9, page 137.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What does the title 'Kabeendra' signify about Pratap Malla?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: It signifies that he was a highly skilled poet and patron of poetry.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: 'कविन्द्र' को अर्थ 'कविहरूको राजा' हो, जसले उनको काव्यिक प्रतिभा र कविताप्रतिको प्रेमलाई दर्शाउँछ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: 'Kabeendra' means 'king of poets', which signifies his poetic talent and love for poetry. Citations: chapter 9, page 137.

questions.title: Read the following text and do the tasks.

passage.title: NOTICE!
passage.content:
Sanskriti Sadan Secondary School
Sundarbazar-4, Lamjung
June 3, 2025

This is to inform all the students that our school is organising a Tree Plantation Programme to create awareness among the students and the public about the importance of conserving trees. This event is a part of the World Environment Day Celebration on June 5.

All students are requested to participate actively in the programme. About two hundred different seedlings, including fruit and decorative plants, will be planted within the school premises on this occasion. The programme will start at 10:00 AM. Students should gather in the school ground in their house uniforms. Tools for planting will be provided by the school, but students are encouraged to bring their own gloves.

Please register your name with your class teacher by June 4.

Headteacher

subSections.title: Write 'TRUE' for true, 'FALSE' for false, or 'NOT GIVEN' if the information is not in the text.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The notice is for the teachers of the school.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: FALSE
subQuestions.explanationNepali: सूचनाको पहिलो वाक्यमा "This is to inform all the students..." भनिएको छ, जसको अर्थ यो विद्यार्थीहरूको लागि हो।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The first sentence of the notice says, "This is to inform all the students...", meaning it is for the students. Citations: chapter 12, page 208.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The main purpose of the programme is to beautify the school.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: FALSE
subQuestions.explanationNepali: सूचनाले मुख्य उद्देश्य "to create awareness... about the importance of conserving trees" भनेको छ, स्कूललाई सुन्दर बनाउनु मात्र होइन।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The notice states the main purpose is "to create awareness... about the importance of conserving trees," not just to beautify the school. Citations: chapter 12, page 208.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The programme is being held on June 5.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: TRUE
subQuestions.explanationNepali: सूचनामा उल्लेख छ कि कार्यक्रम "World Environment Day Celebration on June 5" को অংশको रूपमा आयोजना गरिएको छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The notice mentions the programme is part of the "World Environment Day Celebration on June 5." Citations: chapter 12, page 208.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Students have to bring their own tools for planting.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: FALSE
subQuestions.explanationNepali: सूचनामा भनिएको छ, "Tools for planting will be provided by the school," जसको अर्थ हो कि औजारहरू स्कूलले उपलब्ध गराउनेछ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The notice says, "Tools for planting will be provided by the school," meaning the school will provide the tools. Citations: chapter 12, page 208.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The Ward Chairperson will be the chief guest of the programme.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: NOT GIVEN
subQuestions.explanationNepali: सूचनामा कार्यक्रमको लागि कुनै प्रमुख अतिथिको बारेमा उल्लेख गरिएको छैन।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The notice does not mention any chief guest for the programme. Citations: chapter 12, page 208.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Who has issued this notice?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: The Headteacher of Sanskriti Sadan Secondary School has issued this notice.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: सूचनाको अन्त्यमा 'Headteacher' भनेर हस्ताक्षर गरिएको छ, र स्कूलको नाम माथि उल्लेख छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The notice is signed 'Headteacher' at the end, and the school's name is mentioned at the top. Citations: chapter 12, page 208.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: On what occasion is the programme being organized?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: The programme is being organized on the occasion of World Environment Day.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: सूचनामा उल्लेख छ, "as part of the World Environment Day Celebration..."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The notice states, "as part of the World Environment Day Celebration..." Citations: chapter 12, page 208.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: How many seedlings will be planted?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: About two hundred seedlings will be planted.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: सूचनामा भनिएको छ, "About two hundred different seedlings... will be planted..."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The notice says, "About two hundred different seedlings... will be planted..." Citations: chapter 12, page 208.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What are the students required to wear?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: They are required to wear their house uniforms.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: सूचनामा विद्यार्थीहरूलाई "in their house uniforms" मा जम्मा हुन भनिएको छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The notice asks students to gather "in their house uniforms." Citations: chapter 12, page 208.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What should the students do to participate in the programme?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: They should register their names with their class teacher.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: सूचनाले विद्यार्थीहरूलाई "register your name with your class teacher by June 4" गर्न आग्रह गर्दछ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The notice asks students to "register your name with your class teacher by June 4." Citations: chapter 12, page 208.

questions.title: Read the following text and do the tasks.

passage.title: Thanksgiving around the World
passage.content:
Thanksgiving is celebrated to extend thanks for the harvest. Even though it seems uniquely American, the tradition is followed in different countries in various forms.

Thanksgiving, USA: Celebrated on the fourth Thursday of November, it commemorates the feast the Pilgrims held after the first harvest in 1621. Roast turkey is essential. Parades are a big part of the celebrations too, like Macy's Thanksgiving parade in New York.

Chuseok, South Korea: Also called Hangawi, it is celebrated on the 15th day of August, according to the lunar calendar, to commemorate the fall harvest and to honour one's ancestors. The food most associated with the holiday is songpyeon, a crescent-shaped rice cake. Other activities include tug-of-war competitions and archery contests.

Dia de Acao de Gracas, Brazil: Established in 1949 after President Gaspar Dutra visited the USA, it begins with a mass to offer thanks for an abundant harvest, then there is a vibrant carnival and revellers head to the beach. Roasted turkey is the centrepiece, but a sauce made of Jaboticaba, the 'Brazilian grape', is used instead of cranberry sauce.

Homowo, Ghana: This festival, meaning 'to jeer or hoot at hunger', historically celebrates the ending of a long famine. Palm nut soup with fish is served alongside traditional Kpokoi. The festival culminates in a night of singing and dancing and frantic beating of drums in loud defiance of hunger and famine.

Mehregan, Iran: A festival that dates back to the 4th century BC, it celebrates a successful harvest and the goddess Mehr. The celebration calls for new clothes and a feast on a table decorated with marjoram. Revellers rub kohl around their eyes as a good omen.

subSections.title: Match the festivals in Column ‘A’ with their unique features in Column ‘B’.

B.text: Celebrates the end of a famine with drumming
Features large parades and roast turkey
An ancient festival where revellers wear new clothes and use kohl
Includes archery and eating crescent-shaped rice cakes
Combines a religious mass with a beach carnival

subSections.explanationNepali: यो मिलान पाठमा वर्णन गरिएका विभिन्न चाडपर्वहरू र तिनका अद्वितीय विशेषताहरूमा आधारित छ।
subSections.explanationEnglish: This matching is based on the unique features of the different festivals described in the text. Citations: chapter 2, pages 24-27.

subSections.title: Fill in the blanks with the correct information from the text.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The American Thanksgiving commemorates the feast held by the __________ in 1621.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: Pilgrims
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले बताउँछ कि अमेरिकी थ्यांक्सगिभिङले "the feast the Pilgrims held after the first harvest in 1621" को सम्झना गर्दछ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text states that the American Thanksgiving "commemorates the feast the Pilgrims held after the first harvest in 1621." Citations: chapter 2, page 24.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The Korean festival Chuseok is also known as __________.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: Hangawi
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले उल्लेख गर्छ, "Chuseok, also called Hangawi..."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text mentions, "Chuseok, also called Hangawi..." Citations: chapter 2, page 25.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: In Brazil, a sauce made from __________ is used with the turkey.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: Jaboticaba
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले ब्राजिलको बारेमा भन्छ, "...a sauce made of Jaboticaba, known as the 'Brazilian grape', is whipped up..."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text says about Brazil, "...a sauce made of Jaboticaba, known as the 'Brazilian grape', is whipped up..." Citations: chapter 2, page 25.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The festival of Homowo in Ghana means to jeer or hoot at __________.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: hunger
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले बताउँछ, "The Homowo festival, meaning to jeer or hoot at hunger..."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text states, "The Homowo festival, meaning to jeer or hoot at hunger..." Citations: chapter 2, page 27.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The Iranian festival Mehregan celebrates a successful harvest and the goddess __________.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: Mehr
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले उल्लेख गर्छ, "Mehregan in Iran... celebrates a successful harvest and the goddess Mehr."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text mentions, "Mehregan in Iran... celebrates a successful harvest and the goddess Mehr." Citations: chapter 2, page 27.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What is the main purpose of Thanksgiving celebrations around the world?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: The main purpose is to extend thanks for the harvest.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठको पहिलो अनुच्छेदमा भनिएको छ, "Thanksgiving is celebrated around the world to extend thanks for the harvest..."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The first paragraph of the text states, "Thanksgiving is celebrated around the world to extend thanks for the harvest..." Citations: chapter 2, page 24.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What is 'songpyeon'?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: It is a crescent-shaped rice cake eaten during Chuseok in South Korea.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले यसलाई "a crescent-shaped rice cake that is cooked on a bed of pine needles" को रूपमा वर्णन गर्दछ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text describes it as "a crescent-shaped rice cake that is cooked on a bed of pine needles." Citations: chapter 2, page 25.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: How did Thanksgiving start in Brazil?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: It was established in 1949 by the Brazilian President after he was fascinated with the holiday during a visit to the USA.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले बताउँछ कि ब्राजिलका राष्ट्रपतिले संयुक्त राज्य अमेरिकाको भ्रमण गरेपछि यो पर्व स्थापना गरेका थिए।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text explains that the Brazilian President established the festival after visiting the USA. Citations: chapter 2, page 25.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What does the frantic beating of drums signify during Homowo?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: It signifies a loud defiance of hunger and famine.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले उल्लेख गर्छ, "...frantic beating of drums in loud defiance of hunger and famine."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text mentions, "...frantic beating of drums in loud defiance of hunger and famine." Citations: chapter 2, page 27.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What is considered a good omen during Mehregan in Iran?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: Rubbing kohl around the eyes is considered a good omen.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले बताउँछ, "Revellers rub kohl around their eyes as a good omen..."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text states, "Revellers rub kohl around their eyes as a good omen..." Citations: chapter 2, page 27.

questions.title: Write a set of rules and regulations for the visitors of a museum.

sampleAnswer.title: Museum Rules and Regulations
sampleAnswer.content:
To ensure a pleasant experience for all visitors and to protect our valuable exhibits, please adhere to the following rules:

1. All visitors must buy a ticket at the entrance.
2. Do not touch any of the artifacts or exhibits on display.
3. Please maintain silence inside the museum halls.
4. Flash photography is strictly prohibited as it can damage the artworks.
5. Food and drinks are not allowed inside the exhibition areas.
6. If you are part of a tour, please stay with your group and guide.
7. Please walk, do not run inside the museum.
8. Help us keep the premises clean by using the dustbins provided.
sampleAnswer.explanationNepali: यो उत्तरले संग्रहालयका आगन्तुकहरूका लागि नियमहरूको एक सेट प्रस्तुत गर्दछ, दिइएको संकेतहरू प्रयोग गर्दै। प्रत्येक नियम स्पष्ट र संक्षिप्त छ, जसले पालना गर्न सजिलो बनाउँछ। नियमहरूले टिकट खरिद गर्ने, प्रदर्शनीहरूलाई नछुने, शान्ति कायम राख्ने, र फोटोग्राफी जस्ता महत्त्वपूर्ण पक्षहरूलाई समेट्छ।
sampleAnswer.explanationEnglish: This answer provides a set of rules for museum visitors using the given clues. Each rule is clear and concise, making it easy to follow. The rules cover important aspects like purchasing tickets, not touching exhibits, maintaining silence, and photography. Citations: chapter 4, page 65.

questions.title: Develop a readable story in about 100 words with the help of the given clues. Also supply a suitable title and a moral.
clues: finds a pitcher with little water

sampleAnswer.title: The Thirsty Crow
sampleAnswer.content:
Once, on a hot summer day, a crow became very thirsty. He flew here and there in search of water but found none. At last, he saw a pitcher with a little water at the bottom. He tried to drink from it, but his beak could not reach the water. He was disappointed. Then, he saw some pebbles lying nearby and got an idea. He picked up the pebbles one by one and dropped them into the pitcher. Slowly, the water level rose. The crow drank the water to his heart's content and flew away happily.

Moral: Where there is a will, there is a way.
sampleAnswer.explanationNepali: यो उत्तरले दिइएको संकेतहरू प्रयोग गरेर एक प्रसिद्ध कथा, 'तिर्खाएको काग' को विकास गर्दछ। यसले कथालाई तार्किक रूपमा प्रस्तुत गर्दछ, एक उपयुक्त शीर्षक र नैतिक शिक्षा प्रदान गर्दछ। कथा लगभग १०० शब्दहरूको शब्द सीमा भित्र छ।
sampleAnswer.explanationEnglish: This answer develops the famous story of 'The Thirsty Crow' using the provided clues. It presents the narrative logically, provides a suitable title, and a moral. The story is within the word limit of about 100 words. Citations: chapter 9, page 150.

questions.title: Migration of students and professionals abroad is a major issue in Nepal. Write an essay in about 150 words on its causes and effects.

sampleAnswer.content:
The migration of students and professionals from Nepal to foreign countries has become a significant trend with profound consequences. The primary causes for this exodus are the pursuit of better educational opportunities, higher-paying jobs, and a more stable political and economic environment. In Nepal, limited university placements, a lack of specialized courses, and widespread unemployment push our brightest minds to seek their future abroad. The allure of a better quality of life and global exposure, often glamorized through social media, further fuels this ambition.

While migration can bring benefits like remittances, which are a lifeline for Nepal's economy, its negative effects are alarming. The most critical impact is 'brain drain', the loss of skilled and educated individuals who are essential for the country's development in sectors like healthcare, engineering, and technology. This creates a vacuum of expertise and hinders national progress. Socially, it leads to separated families and an aging population in rural areas. To mitigate this issue, Nepal must focus on creating a conducive environment with better job prospects and quality education to retain its valuable human capital.
sampleAnswer.explanationNepali: यो उत्तरले नेपालबाट विद्यार्थी र पेशेवरहरूको विदेश पलायनको कारण र प्रभावबारे निबन्ध प्रस्तुत गर्दछ। पहिलो अनुच्छेदले राम्रो शिक्षा र रोजगारीको अवसर जस्ता कारणहरूमा केन्द्रित छ। दोस्रो अनुच्छेदले 'brain drain' र सामाजिक प्रभाव जस्ता नकारात्मक असरहरू र समाधानका उपायहरूमाथि छलफल गर्दछ। निबन्धले विषयलाई सन्तुलित रूपमा प्रस्तुत गर्दछ र लगभग १५० शब्दहरूको शब्द सीमा भित्र रहन्छ।
sampleAnswer.explanationEnglish: This answer presents an essay on the causes and effects of migration of students and professionals from Nepal. The first paragraph focuses on causes like better education and job opportunities. The second paragraph discusses negative effects like 'brain drain' and social impacts, along with potential solutions. The essay covers the topic in a balanced way and is within the word limit of about 150 words. Citations: chapter 13, page 226.

questions.title: Write a letter to the editor of a national daily in about 200 words, drawing attention to the problem of unmanaged garbage in your locality.
clues: describe the problem (piles of garbage, foul smell)

sampleAnswer.title: Unmanaged Garbage in Koteshwor
sampleAnswer.content:
The Editor,
The Rising Nepal,
Dharmapath, Kathmandu

Subject: Regarding the problem of unmanaged garbage.

Dear Sir,

Through the columns of your esteemed newspaper, I would like to draw the attention of the concerned authorities to the serious problem of unmanaged garbage in our locality, Koteshwor.

For the past few months, garbage has not been collected regularly. Heaps of waste can be seen piled up on roadsides and in open spaces, creating a very unhygienic environment. The foul smell emanating from the rotting garbage has made it difficult for residents to even walk on the streets. This situation poses a severe threat to public health, as it has become a breeding ground for flies, mosquitoes, and other disease-carrying pests. We fear an outbreak of diseases like cholera and dengue if immediate action is not taken.

The environmental impact is also concerning, with plastic waste clogging drains and polluting our surroundings. I suggest that the municipality should ensure regular and timely garbage collection. Placing more dustbins at various points and launching awareness campaigns about proper waste disposal could also be effective solutions. I hope the authorities will wake up from their slumber and take necessary steps to address this pressing issue.

Yours truly,
(Your Name)
A concerned resident of Koteshwor
sampleAnswer.explanationNepali: यो उत्तरले एक राष्ट्रिय दैनिकको सम्पादकलाई पत्रको रूपमा प्रस्तुत गरिएको छ, जसले अव्यवस्थित फोहोरको समस्यालाई उजागर गर्दछ। यसले समस्याको वर्णन गर्दछ, सार्वजनिक स्वास्थ्य र वातावरणमा यसको प्रभावहरूलाई हाइलाइट गर्दछ, र नियमित संकलन र जनचेतना जस्ता व्यावहारिक समाधानहरू सुझाव दिन्छ। पत्रको ढाँचा र टोन औपचारिक छ, जुन यस्तो पत्रको लागि उपयुक्त छ। यो लगभग २०० शब्दको छ।
sampleAnswer.explanationEnglish: This answer is a letter to the editor of a national daily, highlighting the problem of unmanaged garbage. It describes the problem, highlights its effects on public health and the environment, and suggests practical solutions like regular collection and awareness campaigns. The format and tone are formal, appropriate for such a letter. It is approximately 200 words. Citations: chapter 5, page 81.

questions.title: Reproduce the following sentences as instructed in the brackets.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: I am a student, __________? (Add a correct question tag.)
subQuestions.correctAnswer: I am a student, aren't I?
subQuestions.explanationNepali: जब 'I am' सकारात्मक वाक्यमा हुन्छ, प्रश्न ट्याग 'aren't I?' हुन्छ। यो एक विशेष नियम हो।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: When 'I am' is in a positive statement, the question tag is 'aren't I?'. This is a special rule. Citations: chapter 14, page 237.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: She goes to the temple every Saturday. (Change into negative.)
subQuestions.correctAnswer: She does not go to the temple every Saturday.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: साधारण वर्तमान काल (v5) को वाक्यलाई नकारात्मक बनाउन, सहायक क्रिया 'does not' + v1 को प्रयोग गरिन्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: To make a simple present tense (v5) sentence negative, the auxiliary verb 'does not' + v1 is used. Citations: chapter 11, page 183.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: My father bought a new car last week. (Change into 'What' question.)
subQuestions.correctAnswer: What did your father buy last week?
subQuestions.explanationNepali: 'a new car' (object) बारे प्रश्न सोध्न, 'What' प्रयोग गरिन्छ र भूतकालको लागि सहायक क्रिया 'did' को साथ प्रश्न बनाइन्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: To ask about the object 'a new car', 'What' is used, and a question is formed with the auxiliary verb 'did' for the simple past. Citations: chapter 18, page 301.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The mechanic is going to ________ (repair) my bike. (Use the correct form of the verb 'repair' to complete the sentence.)
subQuestions.correctAnswer: The mechanic is going to repair my bike.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: 'be going to' पछि क्रियाको मूल रूप (v1) को प्रयोग हुन्छ, जसले भविष्यको योजनालाई जनाउँछ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: 'be going to' is followed by the base form of the verb (v1) to indicate a future plan. Citations: chapter 12, page 202.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: He said to me, "Please help me." (Change into indirect speech.)
subQuestions.correctAnswer: He requested me to help him.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: 'Please' भएको आदेशात्मक वाक्यलाई अप्रत्यक्ष बोलीमा परिवर्तन गर्दा, रिपोर्टिङ क्रिया 'requested' को प्रयोग गरिन्छ र 'to' + infinitive को संरचना अपनाइन्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: When changing an imperative sentence with 'Please' to indirect speech, the reporting verb 'requested' is used, followed by the 'to' + infinitive structure. Citations: chapter 3, page 40.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: They are building a new road. (Change into passive voice.)
subQuestions.correctAnswer: A new road is being built by them.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: वर्तमान निरन्तर काल (is/are + v-ing) को वाक्यलाई passive voice मा परिवर्तन गर्दा, संरचना 'object + is/are + being + v3' हुन्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: To change a present continuous tense (is/are + v-ing) sentence into the passive voice, the structure becomes 'object + is/are + being + v3'. Citations: chapter 8, page 131.

questions.title: Choose and copy the correct answers from the brackets to complete the given text. (Rewriting the text is not compulsory.)
questions.passage: A few years ago, a team of young volunteers went to (a) _____ (a/an/the/no article) remote village in Nepal. One of them (b) _____ (is/was/are/were) a doctor. They (c) _____ (reached/were reaching/had reached/have reached) the village after walking for two days. The villagers were very happy, (d) _____ (were they/weren't they/did they/didn't they)? (e) _____ (Despite/Although/Because of/Because) the difficult journey, the volunteers were full of energy. A health camp was set up (f) _____ (by/with/for/from) them. The team leader asked a villager (g) _____ (if they need/if they needed/do they need/did they need) any specific help. Many sick people (h) _____ (were treated/treated/had treated/are treated) for free. If the volunteers had not gone there, the people (i) _____ (will not get/would not get/would not have gotten/had not gotten) medical care. The volunteers made the villagers (j) _____ (to promise/promise/promised/promising) to focus on sanitation.

gaps.explanationNepali: 'remote' शब्द व्यञ्जन ध्वनि /r/ बाट सुरु हुन्छ, र यो एक अनिश्चित गाउँ हो, त्यसैले 'a' प्रयोग हुन्छ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: The word 'remote' begins with a consonant sound /r/, and it is an indefinite village, so 'a' is used. Citations: chapter 7, page 120.

gaps.explanationNepali: 'One of them' एकवचन कर्ता हो र कथा भूतकालमा छ, त्यसैले 'was' सही छ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: 'One of them' is a singular subject and the story is in the past tense, so 'was' is correct. Citations: chapter 11, page 184.

gaps.explanationNepali: कथा भूतकालमा भएको घटनाको वर्णन गरिरहेको छ, त्यसैले simple past tense 'reached' उपयुक्त छ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: The story is narrating a past event, so the simple past tense 'reached' is appropriate. Citations: chapter 9, page 147.

gaps.explanationNepali: वाक्य 'The villagers were very happy' सकारात्मक छ, त्यसैले प्रश्न ट्याग नकारात्मक ('weren't') र कर्ता 'The villagers' को लागि सर्वनाम 'they' हुनुपर्छ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: The statement 'The villagers were very happy' is positive, so the tag must be negative ('weren't') with the pronoun 'they' for the subject 'The villagers'. Citations: chapter 14, page 237.

gaps.explanationNepali: 'Despite' पछि एक संज्ञा वाक्यांश ('the difficult journey') आउँछ र यसले विरोधाभास देखाउँछ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: 'Despite' is followed by a noun phrase ('the difficult journey') and shows contrast. Citations: chapter 13, page 225.

gaps.explanationNepali: Passive voice मा, कार्य गर्ने व्यक्ति वा वस्तुलाई जनाउन 'by' को प्रयोग गरिन्छ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: In the passive voice, the agent performing the action is introduced by 'by'. Citations: chapter 8, page 131.

gaps.explanationNepali: यो एक अप्रत्यक्ष yes/no प्रश्न हो। रिपोर्टिङ क्रिया (asked) भूतकालमा भएकोले, क्रिया 'need' लाई पनि भूतकाल ('needed') मा परिवर्तन गरिन्छ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: This is an indirect yes/no question. Since the reporting verb (asked) is in the past, the verb 'need' is also changed to the past tense ('needed'). Citations: chapter 2, page 27.

gaps.explanationNepali: यो वाक्य passive voice मा छ, जहाँ धेरै बिरामी मानिसहरू (object) लाई उपचार गरियो। भूतकालको passive संरचना 'were + v3' हो।
gaps.explanationEnglish: This is a passive voice sentence, where many sick people (the object) received the action of treatment. The past passive structure is 'were + v3'. Citations: chapter 10, page 172.

gaps.explanationNepali: यो तेस्रो प्रकारको conditional वाक्य हो (If + past perfect, ...would have + v3), जसले भूतकालको एक असम्भव अवस्थालाई जनाउँछ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: This is a Type 3 conditional sentence (If + past perfect, ...would have + v3), referring to an unreal past condition. Citations: chapter 5, page 80.

gaps.explanationNepali: 'make' को causative रूपमा, यसपछि object ('the villagers') र bare infinitive ('promise') आउँछ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: In the causative form with 'make', it is followed by an object ('the villagers') and the bare infinitive ('promise'). Citations: chapter 18, page 307.
